cvpiaHabitat
  • Reference

Lower-Mid Sacramento River Instream Flow to Habitat Area Relationship

A dataset containing the Weighted Usable Area (WUA) in square feet per 1000 feet as a function of flow in cubic feet per second

lower_mid_sacramento_river_instream

Format

dataframe with 45 rows and 3 variables:

flow_cfs

integer flow value in cubic feet per second

FR_juv_wua

juvenile WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

watershed

name of watershed

Source

Central Valley Floodplain Evaluation and Delineation (CVFED) HEC-RAS hydraulic model refined for use in the NOAA-NMFS Winter Run Chinook Salmon life cycle model

Details

The rearing WUA was derived from a HEC-RAS 1D model. The CVPIA Lower-mid Sacramento River extends from Wilkins Slough to the American River (58.0 mi). This reach overlaps with two of the study's, Battle Creek to the confluence with the Feather River (189.1 mi) and the confluence with the Feather River to Freeport (33.4 mi). To scale the study's results to CVPIA's extents, we calculate the proportion of the Lower-mid Sacramento River above (34%) and below (66%) the Feather River. Using these values we calculate a weighted average WUA from both of the studies.

Examples

lower_mid_sacramento_river_instream
#> # A tibble: 81 x 3
#>    flow_cfs rearing_sq_meters                  watershed
#>       <int>             <dbl>                      <chr>
#>  1     2000          588830.0 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  2     2500          511765.5 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  3     3000          433134.1 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  4     3500          370989.6 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  5     4000          333820.6 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  6     4500          300994.1 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  7     5000          274900.2 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  8     5500          276080.6 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#>  9     6000          289554.1 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#> 10     6500          254060.8 Lower-mid Sacramento River
#> # ... with 71 more rows
